title: SpaceX’s first “next-gen” Starlink satellites are suspiciously familiar
summary: In a strange twist, SpaceX says that its next Starlink mission will launch 54 satellites into low Earth orbit (LEO), implying that...

title: Congress adds $1.7 billion for U.S. Space Force in 2023 spending bill
summary: The 2023 omnibus spending package includes $26.3 billion for the U.S. Space Force, nearly $1.7 billion more than the Pentagon requested

title: Senate passes orbit debris cleanup bill
summary: The Senate passed legislation that would direct NASA to establish a program to remove orbital debris, but supporters of the bill will have to try again in the next Congress to enact it.

title: New spacecraft, new firsts, new hardware – International Space Station wraps up a busy and historic 2022
summary: 2022 has marked another busy chapter for the International Space Station (ISS). Along with its constant plethora of scientific and engineering experiments, the Station saw the first docking of Starliner, the all-private Axiom-1 mission, and new hardware installed to increase the lifespan of humanity’s collaborative space laboratory.

title: The Rest of 2022’s Notable Nine
summary: Ukraine and Elon Musk weren't the only big stories of 2022. These seven commanded our attention with actions that will reverberate well into 2023.

title: Dark clouds, silver linings: Five ways war in Ukraine is transforming the space domain
summary: Russia’s unprovoked invasion of Ukraine was the biggest story of 2022. Aside from reviving Cold War fears of nuclear war and playing havoc with energy markets, it’s been a black swan event for a space industry still adjusting to a black swan called COVID.

title: NASA Explores a Winter Wonderland on Mars
summary: Cube-shaped snow, icy landscapes, and frost are all part of the Red Planet’s coldest season.

title: NASA Awards Contract for Aircraft Support Services
summary: NASA has awarded a contract to Yulista Solutions LLC of Huntsville, Alabama, to provide support for aircraft used across several NASA centers and programs.

title: Eutelsat taking financial hit from TV sanctions against Russia and Iran
summary: French satellite operator Eutelsat said Dec. 22 it stands to lose up to 15 million euros ($16 million) in annual revenues from restricting broadcasts in Russia and Iran to comply with sanctions.

title: Northrop Grumman clears key hurdle for space-based solar power
summary: Northrop Grumman has completed ground-based tests to demonstrate critical technology required for a 2025 demonstration of space-based solar power.
